thread.title: Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter
thread.title_full: Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter

title: Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter
text:
Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter Post to Facebook Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter  //on.wwltv.com/1LlIuyI   Karr-Lake Area brawl ends game in third quarter 9:47 a.m. CDT October 9, 2015 Prep writer Sean McGoey makes picks for all nine LHSAA football championships. Check them out exclusively on WWLTV.com (Photo: File photo) CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW ORLEANS -- Thursday's football match between Edna Karr High School and Lake Area New Tech was cut short after a fight erupted near the Lake Area sideline, according to New Orleans Advocate . 
The Advocate account, by Sam Spiegelman, had Karr coach Brice Brown saying that a Lake Area player who had been ejected from the game was still near the field and caused the incident. The Lake Area coach, Derrick Lewis, blamed officials for letting the game get out of hand. 
The game was called to an end during the third quarter with a score of 47-7 favoring Edna Karr. 
It was also Karr's homecoming. 
The Louisiana High School Athletic Association says they are investigating the incident. 
To read the full story, tap here: http://www.theneworleansadvocate.com/sports/preps/13650927-123/karr-lake-area-brawl-ends-game <!--iframe-->
